Google co-founder Larry Page will replace Eric Schmidt and take over as Chief Executive Officer in April. Eric Schmidt , 55, who became CEO in 2001, will assume the role of Executive Chairman, focusing externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership, according to the official Google blog spot. View result Eric Schmidt would continue to act as an advisor to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin . ''Page will take charge of Google's day-to-day operations as Chief Executive Officer starting April 4. Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects, in particular working on new products, Eric Schmidt said in the blog spot. confirmed that it would be proper for the attorney general to obtain the views of ministers on the national interest before reaching his own independent decision. All this strikes me as perfectly proper. Chris Bryant, who believes he may have been a victim of the phone hackers, said Friday he welcomed the decision to re-examine the case, adding that it should not have been closed last month. The evidence that this goes far deeper than one rotten apple has continued to stack up, and so a fresh pair of eyes looking at the case is very welcome, he said. Bryant said the police had ''severely'' damaged their credibility by failing to properly investigate earlier. Andy Coulson and the News of The World have denied the charges. OAKLAND
